originalText.text:
One of the best orthopedic practices in the United States. Outstanding technology and capabilities to get your a** back in action.

The staff is friendly and happy to help.  Very attentive.

text.text:
One of the best orthopedic practices in the United States. Outstanding technology and capabilities to get your a** back in action.

The staff is friendly and happy to help.  Very attentive.

originalText.text: Friendly staff. I was seen the exact time of my appointment. I was seen by a friendly and knowledgeable PA who took a thorough history and physical exam. Then the surgeon, Dr. Youm came into the office spent a lot of time reviewing my x-rays and explaining my condition. Although my knee arthritis was severe (bone on bone), he never pushed me into surgery and offered me a least 9 different alternatives to postpone surgery and reduce my pain. He explained each one in detail and never rushed my into surgery like the 2 previous Orthopaedic surgeons I had recently seen. I did a combination of 3 of the alternative recommendations and I am still almost completely pain free after 8 months of treatment. Dr. Youm and his PA are like miracle workers, strait forth, caring, and honest. I highly recommend RYC Orthopaedics and would never go elsewhere. They’re the best!!!

originalText.text: The Best of the Best Orthopaedics Experts! Dr. Rose is thorough in examination, assessment, and ensures engaging the patient to be educated in the experience of what is going on with their body. The support team of Medical Professionals make the total experience a comfort to feeling valued and cared for.

originalText.text:
Surgery coordinator is ruining the entire patient experience.

My surgeon was excellent and the medical equipment provider was also helpful. However, the  reception - Nicole Williams is her name - was absolutely nasty and unprofessional to myself and my health assistant.

I want to make an informed choice and work with in-network providers and facilities. But Nicole's attitude and unprofessionalism have caused me great suffering and miscommunication with my insurance company.

Examples: She was extremely reluctant to provide details to my insurance company, blaming me for asking too much information that they don't normally give. She also would not give me anything in writing, saying, for instance, "the procedure code may change". When I found out (a day before surgery!) their in-house medical equipment provider was out of my insurance network, she refused to give me a prescription so I can find an in-net work provider.

In the end my representative got her out of the way and was able to work with the benefits person at RYC directly. I fail to understand how she could continue to hold her surgery coordinator role, as she was non-transparent, rude, and completely destroyed NYU and the office's reputation.

originalText.text: I am very pleased with my experience at RYC Orthopaedics, as well as the surgical center chosen by Dr. Rose (Manhattan Surgery Center). The staff at RYC Orthopaedics is courteous, prompt in returning my calls and responding to questions, and very capable at managing my records. Dr. Rose is an excellent surgeon – my surgery went exactly as he predicted, my recovery has been fast, and a lot less painful than I'd feared. I will definitely return to RYC for surgery on my other knee and I highly recomment Dr. Rose.
